required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Three Weight-adjusted Vasopressors for Elective Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Three Weight-adjusted Vasopressors for With Combined Spinal-Epidural Anesthesia for Elective Cesarean Delivery: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study compared the effects of prophylactic infusion of metaraminol, phenylephrine and norepinephrine adjusted according to body weight on fetal acid-base balance and maternal hemodynamics.

detailed_description.textblock: At present, the ED90 of metaraminol, phenylephrine, and norepinephrine in the prevention of cesarean section hypotension has been explored. We compare the effects of three drugs on the fetus and mothers at the concentration of ED90 to provide advice on the use of vasoactive drugs for obstetrics anesthesia .

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: pH value of fetal umbilical artery blood

secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with systolic blood pressure reduction >20% baseline value or systolic blood pressure <90 mm Hg before delivery
Number of Participants with heart rate was â‰¤50 bpm before delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of nausea in pregnant women

secondary_outcome.description: base excess of fetal umbilical artery blood

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of vomiting in pregnant women

arm_group.description: During the cesarean section, metaraminol 2ug/kg/min is preventively infused after anesthesia to prevent and treat hypotension.
During cesarean section, preventive infusion of phenylephrine 0.54ug/kg/min after anesthesia to prevent and treat hypotension.
During cesarean section, preventive infusion of norepinephrine 0.08ug/kg/min after anesthesia to prevent and treat hypotension.

intervention.description: Infusion of metaraminol adjusted according to body weight to obtain higher pH value of fetal umbilical artery blood.
Infusion of Phenylephrine adjusted according to body weight to obtain higher pH value of fetal umbilical artery blood.
Infusion of Norepinephrine adjusted according to body weight to obtain higher pH value of fetal umbilical artery blood.

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Operating Room, Affiliated Hospital of Peking University People's Hospital
